cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly northwest, then turning north and paralleling the southeast U.S. coastline while remaining just offshore of Florida before accelerating toward Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct Florida landfall expected – closest coastal encounter will be just offshore of Palm Beach County

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Deerfield Beach through Palm Beach and northward toward the Space Coast
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (>=39 mph) with a small chance of gusts to hurricane force as the core passes offshore Tuesday night into Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground possible along the Palm Beach County shoreline, especially near high tide, accompanied by large and dangerous waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated totals near 9 inches, producing the potential for flash flooding in the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, a brief tornado risk, and prolonged port-side swell that can hamper vessel movements and cargo operations.
